instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2494: What is 820-2494? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problem efi beep at start
threads.message:
Hi, 
i have a problem with this board, beep at start (not ram, efi problem).
i upload the file of the bios (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP>), i can't make a clean me because i can't find krid, is it normal?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problem efi beep at start
threads.message:
This is Intel Core 2 Duo, no ME region, ME region only on intel core iX boards.....

What is the beep sequence???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problem efi beep at start
threads.message:
like an SOS 3 short, 3 long and 3 short.
ok but it's a corrupted bios?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2494</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> problem efi beep at start
threads.message: Just a corrupted BIOS. You can safely take any BIOS and use it, no ME problems.
